findings.lung: Minimal atelectatic change, trace pleural effusion on the left.
findings.heart: Enlarged heart size without pericardial effusion; significant coronary artery calcification identified.
findings.liver: Homogenous without discrete masses or lesions; no intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation.
findings.kidneys: Normal in size, excrete contrast symmetrically; rounded hypodensities likely represent cysts; 1.6-cm cyst in the upper pole of the left kidney with a Hounsfield unit of 76.
findings.bowel: Diverticula noted throughout; focal area of amorphous hyperdensity within the lumen of the ascending bowel proximal to the hepatic flexure concerning for active extravasation; mild bowel wall thickening identified in the sigmoid colon with adjacent fat stranding.
findings.pelvis: Normal rectum; uterus with multiple calcifications related to degenerating fibroids; no free fluid noted within the pelvis.
findings.vascular: Significant vascular calcifications in the aorta and bilateral renal arteries without associated aneurysmal change.
